243441 old <s>cana/</s> ¦ <lex>ind.</lex> (<s>ca na/</s>, <ls>SV.</ls>) and not, also not, even not, not even (this particle is placed after the word to which it gives force; a preceding verb is accentuated [<ls>Pāṇ. viii, 1, 57</ls>]; in Vedic language it is generally, but not always, found without any other <ab>neg.</ab> particle, whereas in the later language another <ab>neg.</ab> is usually added <ab>e.g.</ab> <s>A/paS cana/pra/ minanti vrata/M vAM</s>, ‘not even the waters violate your ordinance’ <ls>RV. ii, 24, 12</ls>; <s>nA/<srs/>ha vivyAca pfTivI/ canE/<srs/>naM</s>, ‘the earth even does not contain him’, iii, 36, 4; in <ab>class.</ab> <ns>Sanskṛt</ns> it is only used after the interrogatives <s>ka/</s>, <s>katara/</s>, <s>katama/</s>, <s>kaTam</s>, <s>ka/d</s>, <s>kadA/</s>, <s>kim</s>, <s>ku/tas</s>, <s>kva</s>, making them indefinite), <ls>RV.</ls>; <ls>AV.</ls> &c. also, <ls>RV. i, 139, 2</ls>; <ls n="RV.">vi, 26, 7</ls>; <ls n="RV.">viii, 78, 10.</ls><info lex="ind"/>
